text: Matti Olavi Harju (born 14 July 1943) is a Finnish former ice hockey center and Olympian. Harju played with Team Finland at the 1968 Winter Olympics held in Grenoble, France. He previously played for RU-38 Pori, HIFK Helsinki, Upon Pallo Lahti, and Ilves Tampere in SM-Liiga.Society for International Hockey Research Database, retrieved June 29, 2015 ==References== Category:1943 births Category:Living people Category:Ice hockey players at the 1968 Winter Olympics Category:Olympic ice hockey players of Finland Category:Ice hockey players from Tampere Category:Ilves players Category:HIFK (ice hockey) players Category:Finnish ice hockey centres
title: Matti Harju
